question: When will autonomous AI agents replace human programmers?
options: Machines will write 99% of code by 2030

question: Which conventional system will multi-agent AI completely disrupt first?

options: Technical leadership doesn't understand the potential

question: When agents make critical business decisions autonomously, who is responsible?
options: The developers who built the system
The agents themselves (new legal frameworks needed)
All decisions need human approval (defeating the purpose)

question: Which capability will define the NEXT generation of agent systems beyond current LLMs?
options: Perfect theory of mind about humans

question: How many specialized agents should optimally work together on complex tasks?
options: Fluid/dynamic number based on task (emergent organization)

question: What would you sacrifice for an AI agent system that increases your team's productivity by 10x?
options: Nothing, the risks outweigh the benefits

question: Which hard limit of current agent systems most needs to be broken?
options: Inability to truly understand human emotions
Lack of genuine curiosity and self-directed learning

question: How should powerful multi-agent systems be controlled?

options: Be largely unnecessary for knowledge work
Develop new types of work we can't yet imagine
